bug.author: Draghtnod
bug.summary: IPP tries to use AVX512VL instructions on a CPU that doesn't support it
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV => 3.4.3 Operating System / Platform => Windows 7 / x64 Compiler => vc15.8.2
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
I compiled with the untouched default setup with BUILD_IPP_IW=YES BUILD_WITH_DYNAMIC_IPP=NO WITH_IPP=YES giving me <denchmark-code> CPU/HW features: Baseline: SSE SSE2 SSE3 requested: SSE3 Dispatched code generation: SSE4_1 SSE4_2 FP16 AVX AVX2 requested: SSE4_1 SSE4_2 AVX FP16 AVX2 AVX512_SKX SSE4_1 (5 files): + SSSE3 SSE4_1 SSE4_2 (2 files): + SSSE3 SSE4_1 POPCNT SSE4_2 FP16 (2 files): + SSSE3 SSE4_1 POPCNT SSE4_2 FP16 AVX AVX (6 files): + SSSE3 SSE4_1 POPCNT SSE4_2 AVX AVX2 (11 files): + SSSE3 SSE4_1 POPCNT SSE4_2 FP16 FMA3 AVX AVX2
Intel IPP: 2017.0.3 [2017.0.3] at: D:/opencv/build/3rdparty/ippicv/ippicv_win Intel IPP IW: sources (2017.0.3) at: D:/opencv/build/3rdparty/ippicv/ippiw_win </denchmark-code>
Then testing with opencv_test_core i got <denchmark-code>[ RUN ] Core_CountNonZero.accuracy d:\opencv\modules\ts\src\ts.cpp(567): error: Failed
failure reason: Hardware/OS exception test case #-1 seed: ffffffffffffffff ----------------------------------- LOG: General failure: Hardware/OS exception (-4)
----------------------------------- </denchmark-code>
Digging deeper i found out that the exception was caused at count_non_zero.cpp on line 316: <denchmark-code> status = CV_INSTRUMENT_FUN_IPP(ippiCountInRange_8u_C1R, (const Ipp8u *)src.ptr(), (int)src.step, size, &count, 0, 0); </denchmark-code>
to be precise within the statically linked code of ippicvmt.lib at <denchmark-code>icv_k0_ownpi_CountInRange_8u_C1R: [...] 000007FED27422AE vpxord ymm18,ymm18,ymm18 </denchmark-code>
vpxord on ymmXX registers requires the AVX512VL extension. My CPU only has AVX512F. I have an Intel Core i9 7900X. Instructions sets MMX, SSE, SSE2, SSE3, SSSE3, SSE4.1, SSE4.2, EM64T, VT-x, AES, AVX, AVX2, AVX512F, FMA3, TSX Seems to be a bug in the utilized ippicv_2017u3_win_intel64_general_20180518.zip. I don't know how to solve this. There seems to be no newer version or source code available. <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Try to use IPP with an Intel Core i9 7900X.

comments.comment:
We have i9-7900X under Linux (not Win7): tests works <denchmark-link:http://pullrequest.opencv.org/buildbot/builders/3_4-skx-lin64/builds/155>well</denchmark-link> and IPP reports this:
Intel(R) IPP version: ippIP AVX-512F/CD/BW/DQ/VL (k0) 2017.0.3 (-) Jul 29 2017
Do you use 32-bit builds on Windows? Like issue here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/issues/12532>#12532</denchmark-link>
Could you run OpenCV app (not sample): "opencv_version --hw" and attach output here? Current workaround:
force AVX2 IPP via OPENCV_IPP=AVX2 environment variable
CPU i9-7900X should support AVX512VL, but looks like OS Win7 doesn't (numbers of context registers are larger, so this mode is not enabled via control flags) - so there may be a features detection issue:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AVX-512#Instruction_set https://en.wikichip.org/wiki/intel/core_i9/i9-7900x#Features
/cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lupustr3>@lupustr3</denchmark-link>

Meanwhile, i found out the same thing. My CPU and Visual Studio 2017 do support AVX512VL, but Windows 7 doesn't. The CPU Features described in your link match my CPU flags, but the required control registers (CR4.OSXSAVE and XCR0[7:5]) are not set by the OS. F$ยง"# Microsoft! I don't want their tile shaped spyware! Nevertheless, IPP should check if AVX512 is available before using its instructions. I used only 64-bit builds yet. The OPENCV_IPP=AVX2 workaround works fine, thank you. <denchmark-code>opencv_versiond.exe --hw 3.4.3 OpenCV's HW features list: ID= 1 (MMX) -> ON ID= 2 (SSE) -> ON ID= 3 (SSE2) -> ON ID= 4 (SSE3) -> ON ID= 5 (SSSE3) -> ON ID= 6 (SSE4.1) -> ON ID= 7 (SSE4.2) -> ON ID= 8 (POPCNT) -> ON ID= 9 (FP16) -> ON ID= 10 (AVX) -> ON ID= 11 (AVX2) -> ON ID= 12 (FMA3) -> ON ID= 13 (AVX512F) -> N/A ID= 14 (AVX512BW) -> N/A ID= 15 (AVX512CD) -> N/A ID= 16 (AVX512DQ) -> N/A ID= 17 (AVX512ER) -> N/A ID= 18 (AVX512IFMA) -> N/A ID= 19 (AVX512PF) -> N/A ID= 20 (AVX512VBMI) -> N/A ID= 21 (AVX512VL) -> N/A ID=100 (NEON) -> N/A ID=200 (VSX) -> N/A ID=256 (AVX512-SKX) -> N/A Total available: 12 </denchmark-code>
What a bummer being forced to waste all these registers and instructions..

what to do?
add OS detection to CPU capability detection and special-case OSes that won't save those registers? modify cmake files to detect some OSes and explicitly disable/limit HW features?

IPPICV package has been updated: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/16639>#16639</denchmark-link>
If this problem is still actual (Win7 is EOL), then please try latest code from "3.4" or "master" branches.
I am not able to test this anymore since i have moved on to Linux on my i9 system. Feel free to close this issue.
